intro: Lastrea nemophila, commonly known as the moss rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Lastrea nemophila is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and blooms.
